title: Spin and Orbital Rashba effects at the Ni/HfO$_2$ interface
authors: Armando Pezo, Andr\'es Saul, Aur\'elien Manchon and R\'emi Arras
abstract:
We predict the giant ferroelectric control of interfacial properties of
Ni/HfO2, namely, (i) the magnetocrystalline anisotropy and (ii) the inverse
spin and orbital Rashba effects. The reversible control of magnetic properties
using electric gating is a promising route to low-energy consumption magnetic
devices, including memories and logic gates. Synthetic multiferroics, composed
of a ferroelectric in proximity to a magnet, stand out as a promising platform
for such devices. Using a combination of $ab$ $initio$ simulations and
transport calculations, we demonstrate that reversing the electric polarization
modulates the interface magnetocrystalline anisotropy from in-plane to
out-of-plane. This modulation compares favorably with recent reports obtained
upon electromigration induced by ionic gating. In addition, we find that the
current-driven spin and orbital densities at the interface can be modulated by
about 50% and 30%, respectively. This giant modulation of the spin-charge and
orbit-charge conversion efficiencies opens appealing avenues for
voltage-controlled spin- and orbitronics devices.
